sparseklearn 0.1 documentation

Sparsifier

«  Welcome to sparseklearn’s documentation!   ::   Contents

Sparsifier¶

class sparsifier.Sparsifier(gamma=1.0, alpha=0.0, verbose=False, fROS=None, use_ROS=True, compute_ROS=True, normalize=False)¶

Sparsifies input data.

Parameters:

gamma : float or int, defaults to 1.0.

The compression factor.

alpha : float or int, defaults to 0.0.

The shared compression factor.

Methods

apply_ROS(X)
apply_mask(X, mask) Apply mask to X.
fit_sparsifier(data[, override]) Fit the sparsifier to specified data.
generate_mask(P, Ms, Mr, N)
invert_ROS(X)
invert_mask_bool() Returns P by N binary sparse matrix.
normalize_by_subsample()
pairwise_distances([Y, W, transform_Y, …])
pick_K_datapoints(K)
polynomial_combination(W[, power]) Computes sum_n (w[n,k] * (x[n] * iota[n] )**power
set_ROS([D_indices]) Assigns the ROS and indices.
set_ROS_from_input(fROS, D_indices)
set_data(data) Assigns the data as an attribute.
set_subsample() Assign the subsampled data once the ROS has been applied.
write_ROS(fROS, HDX, D_indices) Writes HDX and D_indices to file fROS (D_indices are needed to invert the transformation).
apply_mask(X, mask)¶

Apply mask to X.

fit_sparsifier(data, override=False)¶

Fit the sparsifier to specified data.

Parameters:

data : array-like

The data to fit.
generate_mask(P, Ms, Mr, N)¶
invert_mask_bool()¶

Returns P by N binary sparse matrix. Each row indicates which of the N data points has the pth dimension preserved in the mask.

polynomial_combination(W, power=1)¶

Computes sum_n (w[n,k] * (x[n] * iota[n] )**power

W is self.N by K, so that the output has K rows, each of which is a sum above using a column of w. This seems backwards.

set_ROS(D_indices=None)¶

Assigns the ROS and indices.

set_data(data)¶

Assigns the data as an attribute. data can either be a numpy ndarray or an h5py Dataset object. Sets the following attributes:

self.X array or h5py Dataset, NxP self.N number of rows of X (number of datapoints) self.P number of cols of X (latent dimension) self.gamma compression factor (recomputed) self.M size of reduced latent dimension
set_subsample()¶

Assign the subsampled data once the ROS has been applied. Needs to be updated to work with C functions.

write_ROS(fROS, HDX, D_indices)¶

Writes HDX and D_indices to file fROS (D_indices are needed to invert the transformation).
